intro: Melanthesa canescens, commonly known as the hairy melanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Melanthesa canescens is drought-tolerant and can thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a hardy plant in harsh environments.
